answers.answer: Are you on any thyroid hormones?Your FT4 is actually over the reference range, but your FT3 is less than the recommended 50% of its range.  So no, your levels are not completely normal.Since your FT4 is over range, one would also expect your FT3 to be high as well.  Since TSH is counter intuitive, we'd expect that to be lower than normal.It also seems like tiredness/fatigue and disinterest in sports and/or your hobbies seems to be your major symptoms.  There are other conditions that could cause these symptoms and those should tested for/ruled out, as well.Have you been tested for diabetes?  Have you had Vitamin B-12 levels tested?  Vitamin D?  Magnesium?Have you lost weight or are you just unable to gain?   What's your age?

i am 20 years old and i did lose weight 4 years ago when these symtopms were really worse and one time docotrs said my thyriod wasnt normal then after they said its normal to have readings like that and said i am fine. my blood tests show that i am normal

question: i have symtoms of fatigae always tired and sleepy and can only sleep for 2 hours max and always feels tired, swollen hands and inflammation in hands, under weight no matter what i cant gain weight, low energy before i was really atletic now i cant even run for 1 mintue without getting so tired and i cant play sports anymore, loss of intrest in sports and all my hobbies, extreme dry hands, muslce weakness, hands shake, so here are my levels:Free T3= 4.51Free T4= 1.85TSH =2.63
title: is my thyriod levels normal? docots said yes but i dont think so
